abstract: La Finca del Sur has been a haven for a neighborhood of immigrants, evoking the agricultural life of rural parts of Mexico and the Caribbean where many come from. Sometimes the South Bronx intrudes.
snippet: La Finca del Sur has been a haven for a neighborhood of immigrants, evoking the agricultural life of rural parts of Mexico and the Caribbean where many come from. Sometimes the South Bronx intrudes.
lead_paragraph: This has been a cruel harvest at La Finca del Sur. It's not that the land has been stingy with string beans, tomatoes or cabbage. No, the problem has come from the streets that surround this unlikely Bronx farm tucked between a highway ramp and the Metro-North tracks on 138th Street and the Grand Concourse.

headline.main: At Harvest Time, Bronx Farm Works Through a Tough Patch
